section.name: How to obtain Xhtml compliance for Gforge
section.p:
The complete Xhtml specification is available at xhtml specification at w3c.org Here is listed a summary of what is needed to be XHTML compliant: xml declaration all pages should have the following xml declaration: document must be well-formed all open tags must be closed, all tags must stay between < and > all tags must be lowercase must be converted to empty tags must be closed No standalone
tag is allowed;
must be used. attributes must always be quoted must be converted to The differences listed here are the most significant differences between HTML and XHTML, there are other, minor differences. For a complete list, refer to the XMLT specification.
